popupAnnouncement.ctaText: Discover MetaMask Portfolio today. Track and manage your web3 assets in one place!

popupAnnouncementTreatment.ctaText: Watch your crypto grow with Pooled Staking. Stake your crypto and earn rewards for securing the Ethereum network.

seo.pageTitle: MetaMask FAQs: Mastering Your Blockchain Wallet
seo.pageDescription: Your Ultimate Guide to Navigating Web3 Safely with MetaMask. Answers to All Your Crypto Wallet Queries.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Answers to commonly asked questions

modules.question: How do I install MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Go to MetaMask.io and click the “Download” button, which will take you to the relevant store to download the extension or app based on the device and browser you’re using.

modules.question: I’m a MetaMask Extension user. How do I use the same wallet in MetaMask Mobile?

childMarkdownRemark.html:
You can use the same MetaMask wallet on both Mobile and Extension.

Simply install MetaMask and import your existing wallet using your Secret Recovery Phrase.

⚠️ Importing an existing wallet into a new installation of the MetaMask extension and/or app is one of the only times you’ll ever need to input your Secret Recovery Phrase. If any application or extension unexpectedly asks you for your Secret Recovery Phrase, make sure you’re in the right place.

modules.question: Do I need cryptocurrency to use MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Technically, no. You can accept signature requests from sites without any value in your account. Having cryptocurrencies in your MetaMask account (such as ETH, ERC-20, ERC-721, or ERC-1155 tokens) will allow you to invest, trade, play games, own unique digital items (NFT collectibles), and much more.

modules.question: How do I get funds (digital currency) into MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: You can easily buy tokens directly within MetaMask by clicking “Buy”. Different networks and payment methods are available, though your options will depend on your region. You can also request funds from a friend by sending them a payment request, showing your QR code in person, or by sharing your public address.

modules.question: How do I transfer my existing ETH and tokens to MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html:
You can send ETH and tokens from another wallet to a new MetaMask account. Simply copy your new MetaMask public address and go to your existing wallet or exchange to send funds to your new wallet address.

You can find your MetaMask address under account name (in the format 0x12r45...6HJ9).

modules.question: How do I send ETH and tokens?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Click/tap the “Send” button on your wallet homepage.

modules.question: Which tokens does MetaMask support?

childMarkdownRemark.html: ETH and any ETH-based token (ERC-20, ERC-721, and more). You may need to manually import some tokens to see them within MetaMask.

modules.question: Does MetaMask support NFTs?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Yes, although currently only on MetaMask Mobile. There is an “NFTs” tab on the home screen of your mobile wallet.

modules.question: Can I exchange my tokens?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Yes! Use our Swaps feature to swap tokens inside MetaMask.

modules.question: Can I use a hardware wallet with MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: MetaMask currently supports Trezor, Ledger, Lattice, Keystone, and AirGap Vault on Extension, and Mobile supports Keystone. We’re working on adding more hardware wallets to Mobile.

modules.question: What is my public address?

childMarkdownRemark.html: An Ethereum address is a unique identifier that serves as a virtual location for your Ether and other tokens; think of it like your bank account number. See here for more information.

modules.question: How to deposit / receive / send?

childMarkdownRemark.html:
On Mobile, tap the “Send” button on the homepage, or tap “Receive” to show your QR code, copy your address, or request payment.

On Extension, you can also send by clicking the “Send” button. To receive funds, copy your public address and paste it into the platform you’re sending from, or share it with the sender.

modules.question: How do I Swap tokens on MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: It’s as easy as hitting the Swap button, either on Extension or Mobile. Here’s a quick demo to help you get started: https://youtu.be/zeu-a-W2qJQ

modules.question: Why did my Swap fail?

childMarkdownRemark.html:
A Swap may fail for various reasons, although the failure rate is low. The most common is when a transaction runs 'out of gas'. The 'out of gas' error occurs when all the gas that was allocated for the transaction is consumed before the Swap could complete. To prevent an 'out of gas' transaction failure, we recommend using the default Network Fee amount that is provided by MetaMask. When a Swap fails, some of the gas fees may be consumed by the network, but the asset you wished to swap from will remain in your MetaMask wallet.

If a Swap fails, your funds will always be safe in your wallet. If your Swap fails more than once, please contact Support so we can investigate the underlying cause.

modules.question: Why can’t I find a token on MetaMask Swaps?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Behind the scenes, MetaMask Swaps automatically aggregates available liquidity from leading DEXs and Professional Market Makers. If you can't find a token, it likely lacks the sufficient amount of liquidity.

modules.question: What is slippage?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Slippage refers to the difference between the expected price of a trade and the price at which the trade is executed. Slippage is most prevalent with larger orders and during periods of higher volatility.

modules.question: Why do I need to approve a token before Swapping?

childMarkdownRemark.html: ERC-20 tokens are deployed with functionality that allows other smart contracts to move tokens. By approving the smart contracts, it now has permission to execute the peer to peer swapping behavior on your behalf. The Spend Limit permission is the total amount of tokens that are able to move when using MetaMask Swap. By default, we set the allowance to a high value, so you don't have to approve your tokens every time you want to Swap, but you can always configure a lower amount using a Custom Spend Limit.

modules.question: Does MetaMask charge a fee on Swaps?

childMarkdownRemark.html: A service fee of 0.875% is automatically factored into each quote to support ongoing development to make MetaMask even better.

modules.question: How do I keep my wallet safe?

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Backup your Secret Recovery Phrase

MetaMask requires that you store your Secret Recovery Phrase in a safe place. It is the only way to recover your funds should your device crash or your browser reset. We recommend you to write it down. The most common method is to write your 12-word phrase on a piece of paper and store it safely in a place where only you have access. Note: if you lose your Secret Recovery Phrase, MetaMask can’t help you recover your wallet. Never give you Secret Recovery Phrase or your private key(s) to anyone or any site, unless you want them to have full control over your funds.

Use MetaMask on a personal device

MetaMask stores the Secret Recovery Phrase, passwords, and private keys in an encrypted format locally on the device where it's installed.

modules.question: How do I import my wallet into MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: With your wallet’s Secret Recovery Phrase. MetaMask can only load one Secret Recovery Phrase at a time. If you already have a wallet, select the “import Secret Recovery Phrase” option when you set up your wallet.

modules.question: How do I import an account in MetaMask?

childMarkdownRemark.html: You can add an additional “loose” account (accounts added with a private key/JSON file) to MetaMask using a private key or JSON file. Please note: your Secret Recovery Phrase will not recover any “loose accounts”. Make sure to keep BOTH your Secret Recovery Phrase and private keys (for any accounts not derived from your Secret Recovery Phrase, such as imported accounts) securely stored to recover all your accounts.

modules.question: Lost my password: How do I restore my wallet?

childMarkdownRemark.html: If you cannot remember your password, you must restore your account using your Secret Recovery Phrase and create a new password. See our article for more information.

modules.question: Lost my Secret Recovery Phrase: Can I restore my wallet?

childMarkdownRemark.html: The Secret Recovery Phrase is the last resort when it comes to recovering an account. There are ways to try to find and restore the Secret Recovery Phrase on a computer his requires access to the computer with the installation of MetaMask or a backup of the computer.

modules.question: Privacy of my accounts

childMarkdownRemark.html:
When using MetaMask with sites

MetaMask keeps your wallet data private unless you authorize permission to share your account address. You will see a MetaMask confirmation when websites request access to view your account address.

When using MetaMask for transactions

Transactions made using MetaMask are registered on Ethereum blockchain and are publicly available. If someone knows your account address, they can see the transaction is made by you because accounts on the Ethereum network are pseudonymous.

modules.question: Backup your Secret Recovery Phrase

childMarkdownRemark.html: MetaMask requires that you store your Secret Recovery Phrase in a safe place. It is the only way to recover your funds should your device crash or your browser reset. We recommend you to write it down. The most common method is to write your 12-word phrase on a piece of paper and store it safely in a place where only you have access. Note: if you lose your Secret Recovery Phrase, MetaMask can’t help you recover your wallet. Never give your Secret Recovery Phrase or your private key(s) to anyone or any site, unless you want them to have full control over your funds.

modules.question: Use MetaMask on a personal device

childMarkdownRemark.html: MetaMask stores the Secret Recovery Phrase, passwords, and private keys in an encrypted format locally on the device where it's installed.

modules.question: Why did my MetaMask app crash?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Please ensure you are on the latest version of MetaMask. If the issue persists, please contact support with details so that we can investigate the cause.

modules.question: Why hasn't my balance updated?

childMarkdownRemark.html: This is typically caused by a bad network connection. We recommend trying a different network.

modules.question: Why don’t I see my tokens?

childMarkdownRemark.html: You may need to add your custom token to MetaMask in order to see it.

modules.question: I can’t find the answer to my question. How do I contact Support?

childMarkdownRemark.html: The best method is to get in touch via the “Start a Conversation” button on the Support page. See here for more information.

modules.question: I found a bug, what do I do?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Either get in touch with Support via the “Start a Conversation” button on the Support page, or submit a bug report on the MetaMask Github.

modules.question: How do I give feedback to the developer team?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Open a Github issue here for MetaMask mobile, here for Extension.

modules.question: I am unable to connect to a site

childMarkdownRemark.html: We recommend reaching out to the site first. If they are unable to assist you, hit the “Start a Conversation” button on our Support page, and we may be able to help.

modules.question: Updating to latest version

childMarkdownRemark.html: Extension updates automatically whenever you lock and unlock the app. Mobile may update automatically, but this depends on your device settings. To learn more about updates, see this article.

modules.question: Where can I go if I have more questions?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Our help center, located on the Support page, has a huge range of articles on different topics. You can learn more about the Ethereum network at Ethereum.org. If you still need assistance, feel free to contact Support.

modules.question: When using MetaMask with third-party sites

childMarkdownRemark.html: MetaMask keeps your wallet data private unless you authorize permission to share your account address. You will see a MetaMask confirmation when websites request access to view your account address.

modules.question: When using MetaMask for transactions

childMarkdownRemark.html: Transactions made using MetaMask are recorded on the blockchain and are publicly available. Others can only identify your transactions on block explorers (such as Etherscan) if they know your account’s public address.

sharedCopy.browserNotSupported: is not supported. Please download a browser that supports MetaMask.
